nodes.bodyText:
Is this empty tar really needed to build on RHEL?
(just try to learn something new)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -26,14 +26,20 @@
 %define apache_group www
 %else
 %define www_path %{_var}
+%if 0%{?rhel}
+%define apache_user root
+%define apache_group root
+%else
 %define apache_user apache
 %define apache_group apache
 %endif
+%endif
 
 Name:           uyuni-base
 Version:        4.2.1
 Release:        1
 Url:            https://github.com/uyuni-project/uyuni
+Source:		noop.tar.gz

nodes.bodyText: Actually no. It is necessary for the Copr build process (not sure how OBS takes it on CentOS packages). Personally, I would like to keep it in to have that flexibility. Otherwise I can take it out.

What about adding a README and a LICENSE file and make it a standard package with tar like all the other?

nodes.bodyText:
copy the LICENSE file from uyuni/common-libs/ to uyuni/base/
modify uyuni-base.spec

add Source0:        %{name}-%{version}.tar.gz
add %license LICENSE (to filelist %files common)



I think thats all.

nodes.bodyText:
uyuni-base-common is used in osad.spec which also build for these old versions.
We have this bad situations that some packages contain client and server components.
So it is better to keep the rhel 6 test here until we really do not build for RHEL 6 clients anymore.
Here and the other 3 places in this file.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -88,29 +94,34 @@ Basic filesystem hierarchy for Uyuni proxy.
 %install
 mkdir -p %{buildroot}/etc/rhn
 mkdir -p %{buildroot}/usr/share/rhn/proxy
-%if ! (0%{?rhel} == 6 || 0%{?suse_version} == 1110)

@@ -88,29 +94,34 @@ Basic filesystem hierarchy for Uyuni proxy.
